q: GamepadTester does not display the pressed buttons
a: You must first connect the gamepad, then open GamepadTester

q: Gamepad connected but GamepadTester still does not display the pressed buttons
a: Probably a gamepad needs in drivers

q: I can not save the config of my gamepad to the .kl file
a: You need the permission of the root user
For each device it is individual, search in the Internet!

q: I have a root but I still can not save the config
a: Probably the file system is in read-only mode. You should to switch it to the write mode

q: How can I change the .kl file?
a: You can make patch (update.zip with right .kl file) for your android device (firmware). Then patch device in recovery (FastBoot/TWRP/CWM)

q: How can I learn more about .kl files?
a: Search the Internet for "Key Layout Files"

q: On which gamepads was the application tested?
a: DEXP G-1, Terios T3, IPEGA PG-9076, Mocute 032

q: Why do I need a "connected" screen?
a: It displays which input devices are currently connected. If the gamepad is connected, its name will be exactly there
